We can begin to move on when we have a complete understanding of what happened that day, when 5 people lost their lives and over 140 were injured.

For my colleagues, my staff, the brave Capitol Police force and the thousands who walk these halls every day, I voted to establish a bipartisan commission to investigate the events of Jan 6. 

We cannot look away or brush off a deadly riot in our Capitol in the name of moving on.

1347319922058293255.text:
The chaos and violence we saw at the Capitol complex were a shameful and grotesque attack on our democracy that will leave an indelible stain on our country. 

Like many of you, I feel a range of emotions. I tried to put some of those into words: https://t.co/zBp2WdSDoY

1347042812299276289.text: We will have a new President on January 20th, but we cannot trust Donald Trump to uphold his oath of office over the next 14 days. Our democracy, safety, and security is at stake.

1347042811493888000.text: For the first time in history we have a President who should be impeached twice but because of the time constraints and inaction of Senate Republicans, I urge the Cabinet to invoke the 25th Amendment now.

1346993198548324354.text: Returning to the Capitol to certify the election of President-Elect @JoeBiden. We were reminded today just how fragile our democracy is — and just how much work it takes to keep it. So even on one of the darkest days in our nation’s recent history, our work continues.

1346912602555883522.text:
I'm currently safe and sheltering in place while we wait to receive further instruction from Capitol Police.

Today is a dark day for our country. It's unacceptable that we have a President who has repeatedly condoned and even encouraged this despicable behavior. It must stop.

1346880967521300484.text: Not to mention, this is all an extraordinary waste of time that should be spent helping people get the relief they need during this pandemic. It is time for us to turn the page and heal, just as we have so many times before, by continuing with a peaceful transfer of power.

1346880966636220417.text: The American people voted in record numbers this election – and they selected Joe Biden to be their next President. Efforts to overturn those results not only undermine our democratic republic – they ignore the will of the people and threaten confidence in our electoral system.

1346582766415179776.text: We got the vaccine in accordance with government continuity guidelines and at the recommendation of the House Attending Physician. I recognize it’s been incredibly frustrating to see delays in vaccine distribution and I will keep pushing for free, fair and equitable distribution.

1346582764259332102.text: Today @repcleaver and I received the COVID-19 vaccine. It’s my hope we can help reassure people in all communities — including communities of color — of the safety and importance of receiving the vaccine when it’s made available to them. https://t.co/SUONAEzEql

This historic legislation would transform the redistricting process to make it more fair and more transparent. The For the People Act:
- Requires all states to use independent citzen comissions to redraw congressional districts

1295080246165807109.text: But most of all, Congress needs to quickly pass legislation to not only save the USPS and protect against this Administration’s dangerous actions, but also to help stop the spread of the coronavirus and help millions of people who are now out of work.

1295080245364690949.text: It means, at the very least, the Postmaster General needs to testify before congressional committees to answer for inexcusable delays.

1295080244572049413.text: It means we must stand together to support a nonpartisan Postal Service and call for the removal of the Postmaster General. And our Republican friends who say they support the Postal Service need to speak out too.

1295080243577880580.text:

1292562474202537986.text: We need bipartisan action now to address this crisis head on and make a difference in people’s lives.

1292562473367801856.text: I will keep pushing for action to expand access to testing, more personal protective equipment, provide expanded unemployment insurance, and to ensure help for state and local governments, and support for our schools.

1292562472566755328.text: The president’s hollow actions are a distraction from the real work that both parties need to do. It’s Congress’ constitutional responsibility to meet this challenge, and only a bipartisan bill can do that.

1292562471799214080.text: Meanwhile, the plan threatens to defund Social Security and Medicare at a time when people need them both more than ever.

1292562471060938752.text: People need help with their rent and mortgages, but the Administration’s plan won’t meaningfully do anything.

1292562470243106827.text: Many people are struggling without their expanded emergency unemployment insurance, but it’s far from clear that anyone can get more help under the Administration’s proposal.

1292562469404258305.text: Unfortunately the President’s actions are not nearly enough to meet the scale of the crisis we’re facing.

1267557409574322182.text: A very small minority are compounding this pain by resorting to further violence and destruction. As Pres. Obama said today, ‘If we want our criminal justice system, and American society at large, to operate on a higher ethical code, then we have to model that code ourselves.’

1267557408689262593.text: Even amid a global pandemic that is disproportionality impacting people of color, the circumstances are too much for many to bear silently or alone. It is inspiring to see people come together to stand up for each other and demand justice.

1267557407749738506.text: The pain our country feels is rooted in generations of institutional racism. We recognize that the anger in our communities is a sincere and justifiable reaction to the long-standing failure to reform those institutions–especially our criminal justice system.

1082736915844079616.text:
You trusted me to stop the influence of big money in our gov. & to end the culture of corruption in DC. Those are foundational issues that impact every other issue I’ve talked about - from healthcare to gun violence. That's why I'm co-sponsoring #HR1.

https://t.co/3vgzgjHwWN

1082419465051168768.text:
We must return to a government that's of/for/by the people. That's why I've signed on to co-sponsor #HR1, a sweeping bill that will:
- Reduce big money influence 
- Limit gerrymandering
- End voter roll purging & increase voting rights
- Expand online voter reg. + early voting
